org.jpws.pwslib.data
Class PwsPassphrasePolicy

java.lang.Object
  org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsPassphrasePolicy
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class PwsPassphrasePolicy
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

This class defines a policy that will be used to generate a random password. The policy defines how long the generated password should be and which character classes it should contain. The maximum password length is 256; the possible character classes are:

  • Upper case letters,
  • Lowercase letters,
  • Digits
  • certain symbol characters.

    In addition it also specifies whether certain confusable characters should be removed from the password. These are characters such as '1' and 'I'.

    Field Detail

    MAXKEYLENGTH

    public static final int MAXKEYLENGTH
    The maximum password length this policy can set up. Value is 256.

    See Also:
    Constant Field Values

    lowercaseChars

    public boolean lowercaseChars
    true if generated password should contain lowercase characters. The default is true.

    uppercaseChars

    public boolean uppercaseChars
    true if generated password should contain uppercase characters. The default is true.

    digitChars

    public boolean digitChars
    true if generated password should contain digit characters. The default is true.

    symbolChars

    public boolean symbolChars
    true if the generated password should contain symbol characters. The default is true.

    hexadecimalChars

    public boolean hexadecimalChars
    true if the generated password should contain ONLY hexadecimal characters. If this value is true, only uppercaseChars and lowercaseChars are of possible additional interest for password creation. The default is false.

    easyview

    public boolean easyview
    true if the generated password should not contain confusable characters. The default is false.

    length

    public int length
    The length of the generated password. The default is 8.

    Constructor Detail

    PwsPassphrasePolicy

    public PwsPassphrasePolicy()
    Creates a password policy with fairly strong defaults. If unaltered this policy will cause a password to be generated that is 8 characters long with at least one of each character class, i.e. at least one uppercase, lowercase, digit, and symbol characters.

    PwsPassphrasePolicy

    public PwsPassphrasePolicy(int value)
    Creates a password policy with initial settings drawn from the parameter integer representation. There is no check for validity of this policy in this constructor!

    Parameters:
    value - an integer representation of a passphrase poliy as obtainable through the getIntForm() method of this class; if 0 this constructor is equal to the empty constructor

    PwsPassphrasePolicy

    public PwsPassphrasePolicy(java.lang.String value)
    Creates a password policy from a "modern" or "internal" serialisation string.

    Parameters:
    value - String modern or internal serialised form
    Method Detail

    isValid

    public boolean isValid()
    Checks that it is possible to generate a password using this policy. Returns true if at least one character category is selected and the password length is equal to or greater than the number of classes selected.

    isEasyView

    public boolean isEasyView()
    Whether this policy bears the generator feature to create EASYVIEW characters only.

    Returns:
    boolean true == EASYVIEW

    hasOwnSymbols

    public boolean hasOwnSymbols()

    setFromInt

    public void setFromInt(int v)
    Completely sets up this policy from an integer representation.

    getIntForm

    public int getIntForm()
    Returns an integer representation of this policy.

    getModernForm

    public java.lang.String getModernForm()
    Returns the latest "modern" representation of this policy. (This is used in PWS Format 3.6 and does NOT include the "own symbols" content)

    Returns:
    String of length 19

    getInternalForm

    public java.lang.String getInternalForm()
    Returns an "internal" serialised format of this policy usable in programmatic context (no canonical format!).

    Returns:
    String internal text representation of pw-policy

    setFromModern

    public void setFromModern(java.lang.String v)
    Completely sets up this policy from a "modern" representation (as used in PWS format 3.6). If the value is corrupted, the class'es default values are set. Reads the first 19 bytes of the input.

    setFromInternal

    public void setFromInternal(java.lang.String v)
    Completely defines this policy by reading from the "internal" serialised format.

    Parameters:
    v - String internal format serialisation of policy

    getOwnSymbols

    public char[] getOwnSymbols()
    Returns the set of personal symbols for this passphrase policy.

    Returns:
    char[] with symbols or null if feature is void

    getActiveSymbols

    public char[] getActiveSymbols()
    Returns the set of symbols which are currently relevant for this passphrase policy. ("Active" here does not imply that symbols are selected for password generation!)

    Returns:
    char[] with symbols or null if feature is void

    setOwnSymbols

    public void setOwnSymbols(char[] symbols)
    Sets or removes personal symbols for this passphrase policy.

    Parameters:
    symbols - char[] set of symbols or null for remove
